text: [Music]
I have really uh several goals in life
uh my first goal is to uh restore
responsibility to
individuals to restore credibility to
the church and to restore civility to
society my goal in life is the good news
and the common good I'm for both I
believe in the good news of Jesus Christ
and I believe in the common good of our
society for people who don't accept
Jesus Christ that we we're in this
together we got to make it together as a
pastor I'm working for the second
Reformation of the church 500 years ago
we had the First Reformation in England
we need another one now it's not about
beliefs it needs to be about Behavior it
needs not to be about uh our Creeds but
our deeds and the problem today in the
church is not what Christians or
followers of Jesus believe so they don't
practice it if they did what Jesus did
there there'd be a whole lot more peace
in the world there'd be a whole lot less
stress in the world uh there'd be a
whole lot less conflict and one of the
problems that I really feel called to is
this the restoration of Civility to our
society one of my models is wilburforce
who had two models who had two great
goals in life one was uh the abolition
of the slave trade and the other was
what he called the restoration of
manners to society now I believe that
we're just becoming more and more rude
with each other and civilization is
losing its civility you do not have a
right to demonize somebody just because
you disagree with them they may be
Muslim they may be Jewish they may be
Christian they may be straight or gay
they may be democrat or republican they
may be and you can disagree with them
but you cannot you don't have the right
to demonize them and we've just gotten
mean spirited and civilization is losing
its civility we need to get back to the
original meaning of Tolerance tolerance
used to mean I will treat you with
respect and dignity even if we totally
disagree I I'm I'm clearly pro-life and
I believe that because of what the Bible
says but I'm not going to demonize
somebody who's
pro-choice and I can have a civil
discussion and a disagreement I'm not
saying we have to past over our
difference say oh no we really believe
the same because we don't but we treat
each other with respect and don't call
each other uh bigot or murderer or these
these you know cancerous words that are
out there and so I'm trying to bring a
new civility uh to society I'm trying to
broaden the agenda of evangelicals
uh in in the last few years evangelicals
actually became captivated to a
political philosophy I think that's
wrong I don't think uh religion whatever
it is should ever be held in captive to
either democrat or republican or
anything else we need to stand above
that so we can offer advice to both
sides and I'm always asked you know are
you left wing or you right-wing and I
say well I'm for the whole
bird because if you only have one week
you're going to fly around in a circle
and the truth is it takes two wings to
fly this government nobody's right all
the time the Democrats are not right all
the time the Republicans aren't right
all the time so we need to just kind of
pick and choose and say what are we
learning from this and that and I have
Republicans who are my friends and I
have Democrats who are my friends and
I'm for my
friends
